programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the finds are a machine gun from World War One, a papal portrait rescued from the bottom of a river and a set of rare maps recording the early settlement of America.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the treasures brought for valuation are an elegant grape holder made from silver, a cabinet of rare microscope slides and a ruby and diamond brooch.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Roadshow visits the Outer Hebrides. Amongst the items brought to light are some gruesome medical instruments and a table made from shipwreck salvage.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the Antiques Roadshow team are presented with an Art Deco cigarette case, a 'shock therapy machine', and an ornate pedestal that had been abandoned in a garage.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel marks the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Trafalgar. Among the finds are ornately decorated ostrich eggs and a box made out of debris taken from the vessel.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team head to Abergavenny in Wales where a strange coincidence unites two Beatles collectors. Amongst the other items brought to light are exquisitley carved whalebone and a macabre pottery model.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the items viewed are a collection of pre-historic spear heads, an early American flag, a highly valuable silver tankard and a pair of spectacles worn by Napoleon.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team visit Dartington Hall near Totnes in Devon to unearth more treasure. They examine a set of royal cufflinks, a letter from Admiral Nelson and a valuable collection of silver.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: A return visit to Dartington finds Michael Aspel and the team with another busy day of finds. Objects under scrutiny include a French cabinet with royal connections.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Ever wondered what happens when the Antiques Roadshow rolls out of town? In this special edition, Michael Aspel traces what has happened to some of the star items from the show.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel and the team are at Lichfield Cathedral in the Midlands. Amongst the items are a small statue thought to be from the tomb of Tutankhamun, an early Punch and Judy set and a sword pistol.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team head for Wales where Michael Aspel and team unearth more intriguing finds including a bust of Dylan Thomas, an intricate book of early silhouettes, and a plate.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The experts return to Edinburgh. Amongst the items are an early Mickey Mouse mascot, a rare deco figurine and documents that once belonged to the bodyguard to Edward and Mrs. Simpson.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The experts converge on Normanby Hall where treasures include a marble bust and a pair of rare candlesticks won in a newspaper competition.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Inside the Pannier Market the team discover a cache of curiosities including an inmate's uniform from the early days of Dartmoor prison and a valuable plate bought for a song at a boot sale.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel digs up unscreened finds from recent Roadshows. Amongst the objects are a ring once owned by the Romanian Royal family, an elaborate bed and a bizarre collection of coffinalia.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team head east to Ipswich where they discover a Duke's chamber pot now used to drink champagne and one of the earliest record players.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team step back in time at the Beamish Open Air Museum. Amongst the items are a rare rapier sword allegedly smuggled out of Russia in the props box of the Bolshoi Ballet.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team enter Border country as the Roadshow visits Manderston. Amongst the items are pieces from Queen Victoria's household, a gruesome Man Trap and Lord Palmer's collection of biscuit tins.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Amongst the objects under scrutiny in Rochdale's magnificent town hall are a gold pencil gifted by King George IV, paint brushes used by LS Lowry and the diaries of a British hangman.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team visits the Royal Hospital in Chelsea. Amongst the items are a Roulette table built to outwit cheats, a collection of buttons worn by Charles Dickens and a gilded bee from a royal throne.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The team are at the seaside resort of Ventnor. Under scrutiny is a family portrait showing a Speaker of the House of Commons as a young boy and 75 Austin vehicles.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Michael Aspel introduces a selection of unscreened finds. Items include an Edward VIII Coronation souvenir that was hastily converted to an abdication mug and early fan mail for Elton John.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Roadshow team head for Lancaster. Amongst the items uncovered in the Town Hall are a valuable pair of clogs, a moving series of letters from Crimea, an anti-slavery ring and a rare tapestry.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: At Coughton Court in Warwickshire, the team finds original designs from one of Britain's leading graphic artists, a bizarre Japanese depiction of skeletons dancing and a lost masterpiece.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK Detectives
programme.desc: Andy McConnell helps a daughter to discover the truth about her fathers working life at the Whitefriars Glass factory.
